Name: Acceptance Criteria - The plant must be calibrated by the Contractor prior to the commencement of production trials in accordance with Clause 5112(i) and the calibration checked and reliably maintained throughout the entire production for the Works.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor
Acceptance Criteria - Submission of results of verification testing of asphalt mixing plant devices against direct measuring of bitumen tank with mix/trial mix test results
Record of conformity - Bitumen Usage Record
2.0 - Storage and Handling of Aggregates, Added Filler and Bituminous materials

Acceptance Criteria - Aggregates must be tested for compliance and compliance confirmed before delivery on site. The aggregates must be stockpiled separately at the quarry or mixing plant, stored to prevent contamination and segregation. Each size should be stored with at least 6 m of space between them or a wall to avoid mixing. Aggregates up to 10 mm must stay in free-draining stockpiles for at least 72 hours before use, with waterproof covers used during wet weather when the plant isn’t operating.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor
Acceptance Criteria - Added filler must be stored in weatherproof storage bins or silos to prevent moisture absorption and the formation of lumps.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor
Acceptance Criteria - Bitumen must be stored in clean tanks and not reheated above specified temperatures or stored longer than showed in Table 5114-1.
○ The Contractor should keep records of heating and storage; if there are not records, bitumen must be used within 24 hours of delivery.
○ Contaminated bitumen cannot be used for asphalt.
Reference Documents - Volume 1: Clause 5114 (c) and Table 5114-1
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor
Acceptance Criteria - Moisture content must be determined in accordance with the requirements of Clause 5129(c).
Record of conformity - Moisture Test Report

Acceptance Criteria - Individual samples of aggregate from stockpiles, deliveries, cold bins, or feeders must maintain consistent particle size distribution. This ensures that the overall particle size distribution of asphalt remains within specified limits defined by job requirements and production tolerances outlined in tables for coarse and fine aggregates.
Record of conformity - PSD Test Report
3.3 - Commencement of production of asphalt in each working period
Frequency - Not less than 48 hours prior to the commencement of a work period

Acceptance Criteria - Submission of production plan which must demonstrate that the hot storage capacity and the production capacity of the mixing plant is capable of suppling asphalt to complete the work proposed to be undertaken within that work period on time and to make the runway suitable for aircraft operation in the event of an asphalt plant breakdown
Acceptance Criteria - Tolerances of bitumen temperature, temperature of aggregates and Asphalt temperature when introduced into the mix are shown in Clause 5116 (f)
Record of conformity - Asphalt Production Records
Acceptance Criteria - For asphalt production, hot aggregate, filler, and bitumen must be mixed until particles are at least 97% coated, ensuring a homogeneous mixture per ASTM D2489.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed

Acceptance Criteria - Mixing time for asphalt should balance efficiency and prevent bitumen hardening. Dry mixing must last at least 10 seconds, while wet mixing should include bitumen addition (max 10 seconds) and ensure complete coating of all particles.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - All asphalt produced in accordance with the 'job mix' must comply with the properties specified in Tables 5116-4, 5116-5, 5116-6, & 5116-7
Record of conformity - Asphalt Mix Test Report

Acceptance Criteria - If during the progress of the Works asphalt produced, with an aggregate particle size distribution and bitumen content within the tolerances specified in Table 5116-7, a non- conformance report and proposed disposition must be recorded and submitted
Reference Documents - Volume 1: HP 5116-2 and Table 5116-7
Acceptance Criteria - Asphalt that is overheated, inadequately mixed, contains moisture, or does not meet specifications is deemed nonconforming and must be removed from the site.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor
4.1 - Sampling and Testing – Coarse Aggregates and Fine Aggregates
Frequency - Not less than 5 days prior the use of the aggregate in production of asphalt
Acceptance Criteria - The minimum frequency of sampling and testing for each coarse aggregate fraction must comply with the requirements of Table 5131-1.
○ The minimum frequency of sampling and testing for each fine aggregate fraction must comply with the requirements of Table 5131-2.
Record of conformity - Aggregate Test Reports
Frequency - Not later than 24 hours after each delivery

Acceptance Criteria - A test certificate confirming that the hydrated lime meets 5106 must be included with each delivery to the asphalt mixing plant. This certificate, along with the delivery docket, must be submitted to the Contract Administrator
Record of conformity - Added filler Certificate and docket
Frequency - Not later than 24 hours after each delivery.

Acceptance Criteria - Each delivery of bitumen to the asphalt mixing plant must include a test certificate verifying compliance with specifications and corresponding to the delivered lot. The delivery docket, detailing quantity and delivery time, must be submitted to the Contract Administrator, along with a testing certificate for each new batch.
Record of conformity - Bitumen Certificate and docket
4.4 - Sampling of bitumen from delivery vehicle at mixing plant
Acceptance Criteria - Notice (24 hours prior) of time of bitumen delivery to mixing plant and taking of bitumen samples.

○ Samples must be at least two (2) litres in sealed, 6ubmitte airtight steel cans with removable tops. They should be traceable to supplier records and handed to the Contract Administrator immediately after sampling.
Reference Documents - Volume 1: WP 5131-1 and Clause 5131 (e)(ii)
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor

Acceptance Criteria - If the test results indicate that the bitumen in the tank does not comply with the requirements of the Specification, the bitumen represented by the sample tested must be deemed to be non- conforming and must not be used to manufacture asphalt for the Works. A non-conformance report must be recorded and submitted immediately
Record of conformity - NCR / This ITP signed by Contract Administrato r
4.6 - Bitumen Emulsion and propriety products – Test Certificates
Frequency - Not later than 24 hours after each delivery

Acceptance Criteria - Each bitumen emulsion delivery must include a compliance test certificate and a delivery docket detailing the quantity, time, and date, both submitted to the Contract Administrator.
Record of conformity - Bitumen Emulsion Certificate and docket
Acceptance Criteria - The number of samples and sets of tests on each nominal size of asphalt produced in the work period must not be less than that specified in Table 5131-4

Acceptance Criteria - During each work period, the quantity of bitumen used in each production run for each nominal size of asphalt mix must be accurately recorded by dipping the bitumen storage tank or by recording the plant digital read- outs before and after each production run. The recorder bitumen usage must be included in the lot submission.
Record of conformity - Asphalt Production Records
Acceptance Criteria - The mass of each nominal size of asphalt mix produced in each work period must be determined, recorded and included in the lot submissions.
Record of conformity - Asphalt Production Records

Acceptance Criteria - Calculate and report the average bitumen content for each nominal size of asphalt based on the total bitumen used and asphalt mass produced, and include it in the lot submissions.
Record of conformity - Asphalt Production Records

Acceptance Criteria - The temperature of the bitumen in the storage tank must be recorded at the time of taking every bitumen volumetric reading and at intervals of not less than once every work period.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
Acceptance Criteria - Asphalt moisture content must be determined at least once per lot when approximately 50% of the asphalt for the planned shift has been manufactured.
Record of conformity - Asphalt Production Records
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Fulton Hogan’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
